title: Cortisol and weight gain
content: Peter says cortisol also plays a role in weight gain. It is a very anabolic hormone to adipose tissue and a very catabolic hormone to muscle tissue. It also affects the liver and glycogen stores via hepatic glucose output ⇒ It’s raising glucose, which in turn is raising insulin, which is now acting alongside cortisol.

title: Chronic undersleeping
content: Chronic undersleeping (most Americans) leads to hypercortisolemia. That is then causing a cascade of biology that is nonoptimal. ⇒ Example, more cortisol means more anxiety. More anxiety means less sleep. Less sleep means more cortisol (and more anxiety). An awful feedback loop.
